segment.source: How to Edit a Published Application with Advanced Settings
segment.target: How to Edit a Published Application with Advanced Settings

segment.source: How to Edit a Published Application with Advanced Settings
segment.target: How to Edit a Published Application with Advanced Settings

segment.source: How to Edit a Published Application with Advanced Settings
segment.target: How to Edit a Published Application with Advanced Settings

segment.source: After a published application has been added and configured, the published application can be edited and additional advanced settings can be configured.
segment.target: After a published application has been added and configured, the published application can be edited and additional advanced settings can be configured.

segment.source: To edit a published application with advanced settings
segment.target: To edit a published application with advanced settings

segment.source: In the Applications pane, add and configure a published application.
segment.target: In the Applications pane, add and configure a published application.

segment.source: Select the published application to edit.
segment.target: Select the published application to edit.

segment.source: Click Edit.
segment.target: Click Edit.

segment.source: In the Published Application dialog box, configure the parameters as described in the following table.
segment.target: In the Published Application dialog box, configure the parameters as described in the following table.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: On the Policy menu, select Commit.
segment.target: On the Policy menu, select Commit.

segment.source: Editing Published Application Properties
segment.target: Editing Published Application Properties

segment.source: Property
segment.target: Property

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Display name
segment.target: Display name

segment.source: The name of the shortcut in the user's Windows Start menu.
segment.target: The name of the shortcut in the user's Windows Start menu.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The display name is not case sensitive.
segment.target: The display name is not case sensitive.

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: A description of the published menu.
segment.target: A description of the published menu.

segment.source: Start in
segment.target: Start in

segment.source: The directory from which to start the application.
segment.target: The directory from which to start the application.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The path does not need to include quotation marks.
segment.target: The path does not need to include quotation marks.

segment.source: Command line
segment.target: Command line

segment.source: The command with which to run the application from within the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: The command with which to run the application from within the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: The full path is required, and the parameters can be passed to the application in a similar fashion as in any other Windows command.
segment.target: The full path is required, and the parameters can be passed to the application in a similar fashion as in any other Windows command.

segment.source: In a domain configuration, a shared drive usually exists on the server where all domain computers map to.
segment.target: In a domain configuration, a shared drive usually exists on the server where all domain computers map to.

segment.source: The directory should be mapped here, and if it is a folder that requires user authentication, the Use MED-V credentials to run this application check box must be selected.
segment.target: The directory should be mapped here, and if it is a folder that requires user authentication, the Use MED-V credentials to run this application check box must be selected.

segment.source: In a revertible MED-V workspace, you can map a network drive with MapNetworkDrive syntax: MapNetworkDrive drivepath—for example, MapNetworkDrive t: tux\data.
segment.target: In a revertible MED-V workspace, you can map a network drive with MapNetworkDrive syntax: MapNetworkDrive drivepath—for example, MapNetworkDrive t: tux\data.

segment.source: For example, to publish Windows Explorer, use the following syntax: c:quot; or c:\windows.
segment.target: For example, to publish Windows Explorer, use the following syntax: c:quot; or c:\windows.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To have a name resolution, you need to perform one of the following:
segment.target: To have a name resolution, you need to perform one of the following:

segment.source: Configure the DNS in the base MED-V workspace image.
segment.target: Configure the DNS in the base MED-V workspace image.

segment.source: Verify that the DNS resolution is defined in the host, and configure it to use the host DNS.
segment.target: Verify that the DNS resolution is defined in the host, and configure it to use the host DNS.

segment.source: Use the IP for defining the network drive.
segment.target: Use the IP for defining the network drive.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the path includes spaces, the entire path must be inside quotation marks.
segment.target: If the path includes spaces, the entire path must be inside quotation marks.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The path should not end with a backslash ().
segment.target: The path should not end with a backslash ().

segment.source: Add a shortcut in the host Windows Start menu
segment.target: Add a shortcut in the host Windows Start menu

segment.source: Select this check box to create a shortcut for the application in the user's Windows Start menu.
segment.target: Select this check box to create a shortcut for the application in the user's Windows Start menu.

segment.source: Launch this application when the Workspace is started
segment.target: Launch this application when the Workspace is started

segment.source: Select this check box to run the application automatically when the MED-V workspace starts.
segment.target: Select this check box to run the application automatically when the MED-V workspace starts.

segment.source: Use MED-V credentials to run this application
segment.target: Use MED-V credentials to run this application

segment.source: Select this check box to authenticate applications that request a user name and password using the MED-V credentials instead of the credentials set for the application.
segment.target: Select this check box to authenticate applications that request a user name and password using the MED-V credentials instead of the credentials set for the application.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When using SSO, the command line should be C:\Windows\Explorer.exe folder path.
segment.target: When using SSO, the command line should be C:\Windows\Explorer.exe folder path.

segment.source: When not using SSO, the command line should be folder path.
segment.target: When not using SSO, the command line should be folder path.

segment.target: Related topics
